meanings.definition: Having a sharp, pungent taste or smell
meanings.sent1: The bitter medicine made her grimace.
meanings.sent2: The bitter coffee woke me up in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The bitter taste of the medicine lingered in her mouth.
meanings.sent4: The bitter cold wind cut through our jackets.
meanings.sent5: The bitter lemonade puckered his lips.

meanings.definition: Feeling or showing anger or resentment
meanings.sent1: She gave him a bitter look after the argument.
meanings.sent2: His bitter tone indicated his displeasure.
meanings.sent3: Despite her bitter feelings, she tried to smile.
meanings.sent4: The bitter exchange of words left a sour atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: His bitter words stung more than he realized.

meanings.sent1: The bitter teacher scolded the students loudly.
meanings.sent2: Her bitter criticism made him feel small.
meanings.sent3: The bitter boss rarely praised his employees.
meanings.sent4: The bitter cold reception made him feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent5: The bitter sarcasm in her voice was hard to miss.

meanings.sent1: The bitter truth was hard to swallow.
meanings.sent2: The bitter reality of the situation sank in slowly.
meanings.sent3: Dealing with the bitter news was challenging.
meanings.sent4: The bitter disappointment weighed heavily on her.
meanings.sent5: The bitter loss left a lasting ache in his heart.
